title: Gunman in murder-suicide on Cleveland's West Side identified
content:
CLEVELAND, Ohio - The 30-year-old man who police say shot his ex-girlfriend and her grandparents before turning the gun on himself is Kevin Wardzala, of Cleveland, according to the Cuyahoga County Medical Examiner's Office.
Wardzala opened fire about 9:15 p.m. Sunday at the Laverne Avenue home where his ex-girlfriend's grandparents live, police said. The medical examiner released Wardzala's identity on Monday afternoon.
Brittany Reid, 24, was shot dead along with her grandfather, 66-year-old Robert Clark.
Reid's grandmother was shot first, but survived the attack. The 68-year-old woman, whose name has not been released, confronted Wardzala when he showed up in her backyard. Wardzala opened fire and a bullet grazed the woman's head, Deputy Chief Ed Tomba said.
Wardzala then went inside the home, found Reid and Clark upstairs, and shot them dead before killing himself, Tomba said.
